Lords of the West

The ancient Chera kings ruled the coast of Kerala (Malabar). They were extremely prosperous due to trade with the Romans. Roman writers like Pliny the Elder mention the port of Muziris. The Sangam work 'Padirruppattu' (Ten Decades) specifically praises ten Chera kings.

ЁЯСС
Two Branches of the Dynasty

Scholars believe that there were two branches of the Chera dynastyтАФone ruled from Vanji (Karur) and the other from Tondi. Uthiyan Cheralathan, Nedunchezhian Adan, and Senguttuvan (Red Chera) were the most famous rulers of this dynasty.

ЁЯП╣
Symbol and Legacy

The bow and arrow was their royal emblem, found inscribed on coins. They generously patronized Tamil poets and maintained a balance of power with the Cholas and Pandyas in the politics of Tamilakam.
